Yes - rather nice ones.

KOSMOS TechTree Integration Config File (for use with Module Manager)

I should probably put that it my sig

Please report any problems with this config so they can be fixed

These assignments are the intended KOSMOS TechTree nodes and should be included in the next KOSMOS update (whenever that is possible)

dammit, the mod gave me too many CTDs, I had to unninstall it, maybe when I get a new PC...

Try Active Texture Manager or the KOSMOS lite texure reduction patch

It's not enough, my game already crashes every half hour or hour, and I only have KW rocketery and AIES that give me parts, with Kosmos (and with lite), it crashes after maybe 15 minutes, usually during loading screens :/ And sometimes without even a crash report.

I only have 4 Gb of ram, probably that, and my processor getting a bit old (dual core amd 3.1ghz)
KSP eats below 4GB of ram (It's a 32bit program). Better use KW redux, KOSMOS lite and Active texture management, seriously. Guaranteed it'll stop em if those are just the mods that you use.

It's not enough, my game already crashes every half hour or hour, and I only have KW rocketery and AIES that give me parts, with Kosmos (and with lite), it crashes after maybe 15 minutes, usually during loading screens :/ And sometimes without even a crash report.

I only have 4 Gb of ram, probably that, and my processor getting a bit old (dual core amd 3.1ghz)

Well, with only 4 gigs of RAM, your system will eat a lot of it, so KSP will only be able to use less of it, meaning that you probably have 2.5 gigabytes to play with. I'd recommend Basic Texture Management, or Active if you REALLY want to shave a lot off.

I already used all of those, except Active texture management that I have never heard of, I'm trying it now, and it seems to have fixed the crashes even with the kosmos pack, thanks for the link !

edit: crashed after two hours, but it's still about 8 times more than without it, so it's nice

I'm adding this in today just for the solar panels, which look lovely.

Is there any other way to download besides the spaceport? I think the spaceport link is broken as each time I try to download and open the zip it says the folder is invalid. I think that is is because of the spaceport as other mods seems to be corrupted when files are on spaceport too.

Is there any other way to download besides the spaceport? I think the spaceport link is broken as each time I try to download and open the zip it says the folder is invalid. I think that is is because of the spaceport as other mods seems to be corrupted when files are on spaceport too.

If it's a very large file (the Kosmos pack is 104MB) and you don't have a fast connection, the spaceport server will time out and not complete the download - it's a problem inherent in the software the spaceport server is based on.

I have made a mirror of the Kosmos pack available here on dropbox.com which does not suffer that problem.
Spaceport is not particularly graceful at handling larger files (such as the KOSMOS package), I can only recommend downloading using download management software.
Thanks for the link Roxette.

I installed the solar panels, but they do not show up in VAB.

Do you know why?

I've installed all nessasary plugins.

My mods:

Fustek

Helldivers Orbital Shuttle

Round Solar Panel

Extraplanetary Launchpad

Mechjeb

Crew manifest

I installed the solar panels, but they do not show up in VAB.

Do you know why?

I've installed all nessasary plugins.

The solar panels are not dependant on any plugin at all. They should work on a vanilla KSP installation. There are really only two possible reasons they are not showing up, either they are installed incorrectly, or you are operating in career mode. The parts are not configured for career mode, you would need to edit the relevant part.cfg files and add three parameters:

TechRequired = advElectrics

entryCost = 8800

cost = 800

( I just invented the 8800 and 800 figures based on double the figures for the standard 2x3 panels, which seemed in the correct order of magnitude )

The solar panels are not dependant on any plugin at all. They should work on a vanilla KSP installation. There are really only two possible reasons they are not showing up, either they are installed incorrectly, or you are operating in career mode. The parts are not configured for career mode, you would need to edit the relevant part.cfg files and add three parameters:

I have a question regarding those parts that house Kerbals... How do I get them out? They have crew capacity, but they're stuck inside. Map view shows the parts are occupied.

I have a question regarding those parts that house Kerbals... How do I get them out? They have crew capacity, but they're stuck inside. Map view shows the parts are occupied.

You have to use Crew Manifest to move Kerbals around.
